websiteBuilder.description: A quick, practical walkthrough to customize your site - content, images, styles, and publishing.

pickPage.title: 1) Pick a page (or template)
bullets: Open the Website Builder and select the page you want to edit (Home, Services, etc.).
Each page is made of 'sections' (Hero, Gallery, Service Grid, Rich Text, FAQ, etc.).
Click a section card to select it; the editor shows its fields on the right.

editText.title: 2) Edit text & layout
bullets: Headings & body: click the field and type. Rich text fields support basic formatting.
Per-section controls include alignment, max width, padding, and optional 'bleed' (edge-to-edge).
Advanced users: each section has an 'Advanced: raw JSON props' area for exact control.

images.title: 3) Add or replace images (everywhere)
bullets: Any image field supports upload from your device (Upload or drag & drop).
Galleries & carousels: add multiple items with 'Add image', each slot has its own uploader.
Service cards and logo clouds also include uploadable image fields.
Uploaded files go to Assets and can be reused across pages.
images.footnote: Tip: Prefer JPG/WEBP. Hero ~1600-2400px wide; gallery ~1200px. Large files are auto-sized; variants are created for faster pages.

pageStyle.title: 4) Global 'Page Style' controls
bullets: Background: set a solid color or upload a full-page background image (covers the whole page).
Text colors: choose Heading, Body, and Link colors for the entire page.
Typography: optionally set a Heading font and a Body font (use available, loaded fonts).
Cards/boxes: control background color + opacity, corner radius, blur (glass effect), and shadow.
Hero text: dedicated controls to force hero heading/text colors and add optional text shadow.

savePublish.title: 5) Save, Preview, Publish
bullets: Save Draft frequently - your changes are stored but not visible to the public.
Preview shows the page as visitors would see it (without publishing).
Publish pushes the current draft live to your website.

navigation.title: 6) Navigation menu
bullets: Open Navigation to add, remove, or reorder menu items.
Link items to a page (slug) or an external URL.

revisions.title: 7) Revisions & undo
bullets: Use the History tab to view or restore previous versions of a page.
If you make a mistake, roll back to an earlier revision.

assets.title: 8) Assets, folders & tags
bullets: All uploaded images are in Assets. Reuse them anywhere - no need to upload twice.
Organize with folders and tags (great for larger libraries).
Click "{{assetsLabel}}" (above) for management.

optimization.title: 9) Image sizing & optimization
bullets: Uploads are automatically resized (server creates multiple width variants).
Large files are rejected based on site policy (size cap) to keep pages fast.
Prefer WEBP/JPG. Add alt text for logos/key images (accessibility + SEO).
Storage is pluggable: today files live on the server; moving to S3/CDN later requires only a backend config change - the editor flow stays the same.

navStyle.title: 10) Website Navigation & Menu
bullets: Open the “Website Navigation & Menu” panel to style the top bar while you work.
Pick a variant (pill, underline, ghost, etc.) and set hover / active / background colors.
Adjust spacing, padding, and the brand/slug font + size — the preview mirrors the nav instantly.
Try Quick Presets for fast inspiration; fine-tune any value and click Save to keep it.
navStyle.footnote: Menu visibility/order still comes from Page Settings (toggle “Show in menu” + sort order).

livePreview.title: 11) Live preview & sticky controls
bullets: While styling nav or page visuals, the floating preview stays pinned near your scroll position.
Use the toolbar to reset, compare, or save without climbing back to the top of the inspector.
Click anywhere on the canvas (e.g., the Hero) to activate Inspector controls for that section.

tipsList: If text is hard to read on a busy background, lower card opacity, add blur, or tweak hero overlay.
Use consistent fonts across the page for a cohesive look.
Service Grid: add images and concise descriptions; keep prices/meta short.
Logo Cloud: use monochrome option for a cleaner, unified look.
troubleshootingList: Image doesn't show: ensure it's uploaded (Assets) or the URL is correct. Prefer your uploaded copy over external links.
Fonts not changing: make sure the font is actually loaded in your app (e.g., via Google Fonts or self-hosted CSS), then set it in Page Style.
Looks different from live: you may be viewing a draft. Click Publish to push changes.
External image blocked: CSP/CORS on the source may block hotlinking. Upload the file to Assets instead.
websiteBuilder.uploadsDescription: Files are stored on the server today and automatically resized into variants. When you move to S3 or another CDN, the upload flow and UI stay the same - only the backend storage target changes.

marketing.title: Marketing Campaigns - Manager Guide
marketing.intro: This page lets you email targeted clients (or everyone) using clean, branded emails with your salon colors and a plain-text fallback.
quickStartSteps: Set your fields (discount, coupon, dates, links).
Click Preview to see eligible clients and the exact email per row.
Select rows or use Send All.
Turn Dry-run OFF to actually send.
Click Send Selected or Send All.
marketing.quickStartTip: Tip: If you change any fields, previews are cleared. Click Preview again before sending.

customize.title: Customize email text
customize.description: Each campaign (except Broadcast, which already collects full copy) includes a "Customize email text (optional)" accordion. You can override the template copy without touching HTML.
customize.note: Leave any field blank to fall back to the professional default.

broadcast.title: 0) Broadcast (Simple Announcement)
broadcast.goal: Send a quick announcement to everyone or a filtered slice (closures, holiday hours, policy updates).
audience: All clients or No future booking (exclude clients with a future appointment).
Only clients seen in the last N days (optional).
highlights: Subject / Heading / Intro / Subtext - your message (Intro/Subtext support multi-line).
Button text / link - optional CTA; relative (e.g., ?page=services-classic) or full URL.
Coupon / Expires on - optional; shown in the email and passed to the link.
Limit - cap total recipients for safety.
broadcast.bestUse: Closures, schedule changes, promos, new policies.

winback.title: 1) Win-Back (Likely to Lapse)
winback.goal: Nudge clients overdue relative to their usual cadence.
highlights: Overdue x gap - threshold (e.g., 1.5 = 50% later than usual).
Discount % - percent shown in email copy.
Valid days - fallback if Expires on is blank.
Expires on (override) - exact date shown and passed to the link.
Limit - cap the audience.
Coupon prefix / override - blank override suggests codes like WINBACK123.
Rebook URL - CTA destination (tracking + coupon added automatically).
winback.bestUse: Monthly pulse to re-activate clients who are slipping.

skipped.title: 2) Skipped Rebook Nudge
skipped.goal: Follow up after a recent visit if the client didn't book again.
highlights: Lookback (days) - window for the previous kept visit.
Discount % - set to 0 for a gentle reminder.
Coupon prefix / override - optional incentive.
Deep link - landing page for a quick rebook.
skipped.bestUse: A friendly reminder a few days after the appointment.

vip.title: 3) VIP Loyalty
vip.goal: Reward top spenders or frequent visitors with early access or a perk.
highlights: Top % (by LTV) - pick the slice of high-value clients.
Limit - cap recipients if you want scarcity.
Discount % - the perk shown in the copy.
Coupon prefix / override - generate personal VIP codes.
VIP link - landing page for the exclusive offer.
vip.bestUse: Early access promos, special events, or loyalty perks.

anniversary.title: 4) Anniversary (Client-versary)
anniversary.goal: Celebrate the month of the client's first visit.
highlights: Month - which month to celebrate (defaults to current).
Limit - cap recipients.
Coupon prefix / override - gift code.
Anniversary link - CTA (tracking + coupon/expiry appended).
Expires on - when the perk ends.
Require email - set to No to preview even if some clients lack email.
anniversary.bestUse: Friendly monthly thank-you with a small perk.

newService.title: New Service Launch
newService.goal: Announce a new service to recent visitors who haven't tried it.
highlights: Service (search by name), Lookback (months), Discount %.
Coupon prefix / override, Launch link, Expires on, Limit.
newService.note: Use the service picker to search by name; the ID fills automatically.

noShow.title: No-Show Recovery
noShow.goal: Make-good follow-up to rebook clients who were charged a no-show fee or marked no-show.
highlights: Lookback (days), Require no future booking to exclude those already rebooked.
Discount %, Coupon prefix / override, Landing link, Expires on, Limit.

addon.title: Add-on Upsell
addon.goal: Offer a popular add-on to recent base-service clients (simple & fast).
highlights: Base service (search by name), Add-on name, Lookback (days).
Discount %, Coupon prefix / override, Deep link, Expires on, Limit.
addon.note: Use the service picker to search by name; the ID fills automatically.

discountPercent.label: Discount %
discountPercent.description: Shown in the email copy. Set to 0 for a non-discount nudge. If Coupon override is blank, the email hides the coupon block.

coupon.label: Coupon prefix / override
coupon.description: If Override is filled, the exact code is shown and passed along. If blank, a smart code is generated from the prefix.

expires.label: Expires on
expires.description: Exact date printed in the email and passed as expires=YYYY-MM-DD.

links.label: Links
links.description: Links automatically append ?coupon=CODE&expires=YYYY-MM-DD&utm_source=<campaign> so landing pages can display the code and analytics can attribute traffic.

preview.label: Preview
preview.description: Fetches eligible clients and renders the final email per row. Change any setting? Preview again.

dryRun.label: Dry-run
dryRun.description: When ON, nothing is sent; we log a "would send" count. Turn OFF to send.

send.label: Send Selected / Send All
send.description: Uses the rows from your most recent preview. "Selected" sends only the checked rows; "All" sends every previewed row.

export.title: Export clients (company-scoped)
export.description: Use Export clients to download a CSV/XLSX of clients who have appointments with your company. Filters include "Seen in last N days", "Min visits", and "Require email". Data is tenant-isolated.

noRows.label: Preview shows no rows
noRows.description: Adjust filters or widen the window, depending on the campaign.
list: Broadcast: reduce filters (e.g., clear "Seen in last N days").
Win-Back: lower Overdue x gap or increase Limit.
Anniversary: choose the correct month and ensure first-visit dates exist.
No-Show: widen Lookback or temporarily allow clients without email to inspect counts.

sentZero.label: "Sent: 0 - dry_run=on/off"
sentZero.description: Interpret the dry-run indicator and selection state.
list: on - Dry-run is ON; no emails sent by design.
off - Likely no rows selected (re-preview and select rows) or the server suppressed exact duplicates within that send.

duplicates.label: Client says they received multiple copies
duplicates.description: We suppress duplicates within a single send (same recipient + subject + body). If you rerun the same content later, clients may get it again.

coupon.label: Coupon doesn't apply at checkout
coupon.description: Emails do not create coupons. Create/enable the matching code in Coupon Management, or keep coupons informational only.

button.label: Where does the button go?
button.description: Your chosen link. We append coupon, expires, and utm_source so landing pages can prefill/show the code and analytics can attribute traffic.

copyTips.title: Copy tips (salon-friendly)

items.vip: VIP: "Early access just for you. Prime slots go fast-reserve your favorite time now."
items.winback: Win-Back: "It's been a while-we'd love to see you again. Book by {date}."
items.skipped: Skipped Rebook: "Rebook the same pro in 3 clicks-keep your routine effortless."
items.anniversary: Anniversary: "Happy client-versary! Enjoy a little thank-you from our team."
items.broadcast: Broadcast: Keep it warm and clear-what's changing, and what clients should do next.

copyTips.subject: Subject lines: keep them short (<= 45 chars). Examples: "VIP Early Access: save {X}%", "We miss you - book by {date}", "Closed Monday - back Tuesday", "A little gift for your month {emoji}".

items.emailsOnly: Only clients with a valid email can receive emails (some campaigns let you preview without email).
items.consent: Include any required consent/unsubscribe text for your region in your base template.
items.tenant: Exports are tenant-isolated: only clients who booked with your company are included.

marketing.editorTip: Editor tip: Long message fields support multi-line editing. Press Enter for new lines.

messages.discountGreaterThanZero: Discount must be greater than zero

campaigns.subjectHelper: Leave blank to use the default subject
campaigns.introHelper: Leave blank to use the default intro
campaigns.subtextHelper: Leave blank to use the default subtext
campaigns.noPreviewRows: No preview rows; click Preview first.

subject.label: Subject
subject.helper: Leave blank to use the default subject.

heading.label: Heading
heading.helper: Leave blank to use the default heading.

intro.label: Intro / Main message
intro.helper: Leave blank to use the default intro.

subtext.label: Subtext
subtext.helper: Leave blank to use the default subtext.

ctaUrl.label: Button link
ctaUrl.helper: Use a relative path like ?page=services-classic or a full URL.

couponOverride.label: Coupon override
couponOverride.helper: Leave blank to auto-generate a code from the prefix.

expiresOptional.label: Expires on (optional)
expiresOptional.helper: Leave blank to omit expiry details.

segment.label: Segment
segment.helper: Choose everyone or clients without a future booking.

sinceDays.label: Seen in last N days
sinceDays.helper: Optional filter; only include clients seen within this window.

overdueMultiplier.label: Overdue x gap
overdueMultiplier.helper: Include clients when days since last visit is at least this multiple of their expected gap.

discountPercent.label: Discount %
discountPercent.helper: Shown in the email copy; set 0 for no discount.

discountPercentZero.label: Discount %
discountPercentZero.helper: Set to 0 to send without a coupon.

validDays.label: Valid days
validDays.helper: Fallback expiry window when no exact date is provided.

expiresOverride.label: Expires on (override)
expiresOverride.helper: Set a precise end date to override the fallback logic.

couponPrefix.label: Coupon prefix
couponPrefix.helper: Used to generate codes like PREFIX123.

rebookLink.label: Rebook URL
rebookLink.helper: Landing page used for the call to action.

lookbackDays.label: Lookback (days)
lookbackDays.helper: Only include clients seen within this many days.

lookbackMonths.label: Lookback (months)
lookbackMonths.helper: Only include clients seen within this many months.

deepLink.label: Deep link
deepLink.helper: Destination path for the call to action.

vipPct.label: Top % (by LTV)
vipPct.helper: Select the highest-value clients ranked by lifetime value.

vipLink.label: VIP link
vipLink.helper: Landing page for the VIP offer.

requireEmail.label: Require email
requireEmail.helper: Set to No to preview clients even if email is missing.

serviceId.label: Service
serviceId.helper: Search by name; the service ID fills automatically.

baseServiceId.label: Base service
baseServiceId.helper: Search by name; the service ID fills automatically.

requireNoFuture.label: Require no future booking
requireNoFuture.helper: Include only clients with no upcoming appointments.

requireFee.label: Require fee charged
requireFee.helper: Include only clients who were charged a no-show fee.

landingLink.label: Landing link
landingLink.helper: Destination for the no-show recovery call to action.

launchLink.label: Launch link
launchLink.helper: Landing link for the new service campaign.

fields.serviceSearchHelper: Search by name; the ID fills automatically.

broadcast.subject: Update from our team
broadcast.heading: A quick note from the studio
broadcast.intro: We're sharing an update with our clients.
broadcast.subtext: Thanks for being part of our community.

broadcast.title: Broadcast (Simple Announcement)
broadcast.subtitle: Send a simple announcement to all clients or a filtered segment.
broadcast.help: Great for closures, holiday hours, policy updates, or general news.

winback.title: Win-Back (Likely to Lapse)
winback.subtitle: Target clients overdue compared to their usual cadence with a limited-time offer.
winback.help: Uses retention math to find clients whose gap since last visit exceeds their average.

skippedRebook.title: Skipped Rebook Nudge
skippedRebook.subtitle: Follow up when a client kept their visit but skipped the rebook prompt.
skippedRebook.help: Great a few days after the appointment to encourage another booking.

vip.title: VIP (Top Clients)
vip.subtitle: Reward high-value clients with early access or perks.
vip.help: Ranks by lifetime spend/visits to deliver a VIP-only offer.

anniversary.title: Anniversary Thank-You
anniversary.subtitle: Celebrate the month of the client's first visit with a personal message or perk.
anniversary.help: Matches clients whose first visit month matches the selected month.

newService.title: New Service Launch
newService.subtitle: Announce a new service to recent visitors who haven't tried it yet.
newService.help: Looks at recent visitors and excludes anyone who has already booked the service.

noShow.title: No-Show Recovery
noShow.subtitle: Reach clients who missed an appointment to help them rebook.
noShow.help: Targets recent no-shows or those charged a no-show fee.

addonUpsell.title: Add-on Upsell
addonUpsell.subtitle: Offer a popular add-on to clients who booked a related base service.
addonUpsell.help: Simple version that skips add-on history for speed.

advanced.heading: Advanced Management
advanced.description: Configure services, staff, and schedules. Review bookings, handle charges & refunds, and open analytics in place.

errors.noLink: Stripe did not return a link. Try again in a moment.

analyticsCard.title: Analytics Overview
analyticsCard.description: Open the full Advanced Analytics without leaving this page.

advanced.tabsHint: Select any tab above to open a focused workspace in a modal. Analytics also opens in a pop-up.

snackbar.updatedHidden: Booking updated (not visible in Available Slots).

edit.title: Edit Booking
edit.info: Changing service will request the backend to re-compute duration and availability (auto_adjust=true). If a conflict occurs, the server will respond with an error and no changes will be saved.
edit.confirmOutsideAvailability:
This edit is outside {{timezone}} availability ({{date}} {{start}}-{{end}}).

Create availability for this span and save?

connect.warning: Stripe onboarding incomplete - Stripe-managed payments are disabled until setup is complete.

ready.withPayouts: Stripe Connect ready - charges enabled and payouts enabled.
ready.pending: Stripe Connect ready - charges enabled; payouts pending.

pageStyle.title: Page Style
pageStyle.description: Background, cards, and button styling for this page. (Text & background images live in the Page Style section.)
pageStyle.applyAllLabel: Apply this Page Style to all pages on Save

applyAll.none: Nothing to apply: add or edit a Page Style first.
applyAll.success: Applied this Page Style to all pages.
applyAll.failed: Failed to apply style to all pages.
applyAll.tooltip: Copy this page's Page Style (background, colors, buttons) to every page
applyAll.button: Apply Page Style to all pages

load.unauthorized: Access denied. Sign in as a manager to edit the site.
load.autoprovisionFailed: Couldn't auto-provision pages. Please try again.

auth.title: Sign in to edit this site
auth.body: Your session doesn't have permission to manage this company (HTTP {{code}}).
auth.tip: Tip: if you just switched accounts, set the correct company context:localStorage.setItem('company_id','{{companyId}}')
auth.switcherHint: Or enter the company ID you want to manage:

controls.title: Controls
controls.description: Manage theme, history, mode, and publishing

tooltips.save: Save this page (but don’t publish it yet)
tooltips.publish: Publish your site live (uses the last saved content)
tooltips.themeSignIn: Sign in as a manager first

sections.title: Sections
sections.description: Select a section to edit; add new blocks below
sections.tooltip: Click to select this section and edit its content
sections.hint: Select a section to edit (or add a Hero).

empty.title: Get started
empty.body: Add a Hero to get started.

drag.spaceAbove: Drag to increase/decrease space above this section
drag.spaceBelow: Drag to increase/decrease space below this section

inspector.title: Inspector
inspector.notMapped: This section type isn’t mapped to a visual inspector yet. You can still edit its props below.
inspector.resetTooltip: Reset to sensible defaults for this section type

imageField.drop: Drop an image or click Upload
imageField.error: Couldn't load the image. Check the URL or CORS/CSP.

inspector.emptySelection: Select a section to edit its content.

messages.importedPreset: Imported Lab preset from server. Remember to Save/Publish.
messages.sitePublished: Site published with your latest edits
messages.importedLayoutLab: Imported settings from Layout Tuning Lab (remember to Save/Publish).
messages.importedAllLab: Imported Lab settings to page + all sections. Remember to Save/Publish.

errors.signIn: Sign in as a manager first.
errors.noPreset: No Lab preset saved on server.
errors.noLayoutSettings: No saved Layout Lab settings found.
errors.noSavedLabSettings: No saved settings found in Layout Tuning Lab.
errors.importPreset: Failed to import Lab preset from server.
errors.importPresetDetail: Failed to import Lab preset from server: {{detail}}

pageStyle.note: Tip: keep this as the first section. It sets a page-wide background color or image with an optional overlay.

employeeProfiles.title: Employee Profile
employeeProfiles.subtitle: Manage your employee details, payroll and contact information.

companyProfile.title: Company Profile
companyProfile.subtitle: Manage your company details, branding and contact information.

hints.businessNumberDigits: Digits only. Letters or symbols are removed automatically.
hints.employerNumberDigits: Digits only. Letters or symbols are removed automatically.

payments.manageHint: Manage Stripe payments, tax settings, display currency, and brand logo from the Checkout Pro & Payments settings tab.

chargeModes.localized: Localized (USD for US, CAD for CA)

stripeTax.enabledIntro: Stripe Tax will calculate the right rate based on your registrations. Update them in
stripeTax.enablePrompt: Turn on Stripe payments so clients can be charged online and Stripe can apply the correct taxes.

public.notFound: Public page not found. Make sure the slug is correct and the site is published.

setSlugHint.prefix: Set a slug to enable your public site (e.g.

websiteSuite.title: Website & Pages
websiteSuite.subtitle: Build your public site, manage pages and themes, connect your custom domain, and launch templates.

stripeHub.authRequired: Please sign in as a manager to view Stripe settings.

connect.title: Stripe Connect status
connect.description: Check onboarding progress, charges, and payout readiness.

status.ready: Stripe Connect ready — charges enabled and payouts enabled.
status.readyNoPayouts: Stripe Connect ready — charges enabled; payouts pending.
status.notReady: Stripe Connect connected but charges are disabled. Finish onboarding in Stripe.
status.disconnected: Stripe Connect is not connected yet. Complete onboarding to turn on payments.

checkout.title: Checkout & payment mode
checkout.description: Review checkout behaviour, cards on file, and Stripe publishable key.

mode.offline: Offline booking — collect payment outside Stripe.
mode.cardOnFile: Card on file — clients secure the booking and managers charge later.
mode.payNow: Pay during checkout — clients pay immediately with Stripe.

help.title: Need a checklist?
help.subtitle: Quick reminders for Stripe setup:
items: Complete Stripe Connect onboarding so charges and payouts stay enabled.
Set checkout mode, publishable key, and logo under Checkout Pro & Payments.
Update tax country, region, and display currency in Company Profile.
Use Advanced Management → Payments to charge cards on file or issue refunds.
Detailed checkout & tax controls live under Settings → Checkout Pro & Payments (link below).

taxGuide.title: Tax setup guide (for managers)
taxGuide.intro: Follow this once and tax will be calculated automatically on every payment.

pricesIncludeTax.on: Prices include tax: (currently ON — prices shown include tax)
pricesIncludeTax.off: Prices include tax: (currently OFF — tax will be added on top)

connect.heading: 2) Connect Stripe (one-time)
connect.useButton: Use the Connect with Stripe button above and finish onboarding.
connect.ready: When it says Ready to accept payments, you're all set.

stripe.heading: 3) In Stripe — turn on Automatic tax
stripe.navigate: Go to Tax → Overview and switch Automatic tax to ON.
stripe.origin: In Business information: set your Origin address (where your business is based).
stripe.products: In Products & prices: pick a default tax category (start with “General — Services”; you can refine per product later).
stripe.includeQuestion: Include tax in prices? Choose No to add tax on top (most US/CA teams), or Yes if your prices already include tax.

registrations.heading: 4) Registrations (where you collect tax)
registrations.homeRegion: Add your home region (e.g., Ontario or Texas).
registrations.additionalRegions: Add other provinces/states only where you are registered or when Stripe notifies you that a threshold is met.
registrations.thresholds: Enable Thresholds monitoring so Stripe alerts you as you grow.

taxGuide.tip: Tip: If your price is $40 and Prices include tax is OFF, customers will see $40 + tax at checkout. If it’s ON, the $40 already contains tax and Stripe will back the tax out automatically.

faqs.title: FAQs
faqs.usRegistration: Do I need US registration to sell to US customers? Only if you meet a state's threshold or choose to register there. Start with your home region; add others as needed.
faqs.receipts: Does Stripe handle receipts? Yes. Receipts are issued in your business name.
faqs.crossBorder: What about cross-border orders? Tax depends on the buyer's location and where you're registered. If you aren't registered in a region, Stripe won't collect there.

primaryColor.label: Primary color
primaryColor.tooltip: Used for your booking button and accent in the embedded widget

policy.title: Cancellation & Reschedule Policy
policy.description: These limits help reduce last-minute no-shows

embed.title: Add booking to your website
embed.description: Copy one snippet below and paste it into your site
embed.choosePrompt: Choose how it appears on your site:

faq.title: How to add this to my website?
faq.subtitle: Most managers should choose one of these:
faq.popup: Popup button (Script) - shows a "Book Now" button. When clicked, your calendar opens as a popup. Use if your builder allows adding scripts.
faq.inline: Inline embed (Iframe) - shows your whole booking page directly on your site. Works everywhere (Wix, WordPress, Squarespace, Webflow).

wix.title: Wix
wix.description: Use <bold>"Add -> Embed -> Embed a Site"</bold> and paste the <bold>Iframe</bold> snippet. If you want the popup button instead, use Wix <bold>"Custom Code"</bold> (site settings) to add the script.

wordpress.title: WordPress
wordpress.description: In the page editor, add a <bold>Custom HTML</bold> block and paste the snippet. If your host blocks scripts, use the <bold>Iframe</bold> option.

squarespace.title: Squarespace / Webflow
squarespace.description: Use a <bold>Code/Embed</bold> block. If the script is removed, use the <bold>Iframe</bold>.

reviews.title: Reviews & Tips (post-service)
reviews.subheader: Automate post-service review emails and optional tip link
reviews.loadError: Could not load review & tip settings.

autoSend.label: Auto-send review email
autoSend.tooltip: If OFF, nothing is sent automatically. You can still trigger sends manually.

sendAfter.label: Send after (hours)
sendAfter.helper: Delay after appointment end before sending the email

requireApproval.label: Require manager approval
requireApproval.tooltip: Queue emails and require a manager to approve each before sending.

includeTip.label: Include tip link in email
includeTip.tooltip: Adds a secure 'Leave a tip' button in the email alongside 'Leave a review'.

autoPublish.label: Auto-publish reviews
autoPublish.tooltip: If ON, client reviews appear on your public page immediately. If OFF, managers can publish later.

reviewWindow.label: Client review window (days)
reviewWindow.helper: Logged-in clients can review visits within this many days of the appointment

tipPresets.label: Tip presets (comma-separated, e.g. 3,5,10)
tipPresets.helper: Shown as quick buttons in the tip flow

redirectUrl.label: Review redirect URL (optional)
redirectUrl.helper: If set, after in-app review we also show a button to post externally (Google, Yelp, etc.)

html.label: Email HTML override
html.placeholder: Leave blank to use the default enterprise template

artist.title: Artist Visibility & Permissions
artist.subheader: Control what booked slots reveal and what employees can do to availability

hints.listPrice: If ON, artists can see list price for the booked service
hints.paidAmount: Sum of succeeded/paid transactions for the appointment

closeSlots.label: Allow employees to Close/Truncate their availability for a day
closeSlots.hint: Enables the Bulk ▸ Close rest of day / Truncate day to time actions in the availability calendar

editSlots.label: Allow employees to edit individual availability slots
editSlots.hint: Enables Edit/Delete on single free slots (managers can always edit)

clientVideo.loadError: Failed to load client video policy.
clientVideo.title: Client Video (Jitsi)
clientVideo.subheader: Automatically include a Jitsi video meeting link for client bookings

fields.enableLink: Enable Jitsi link for client bookings
fields.includeInEmails: Include video link in client emails

checkout.title: Stripe Payments & Card on File
checkout.subheader: Configure Stripe integration, tax behaviour, and saved card features
checkout.loadError: Could not load Stripe payment settings.

alerts.payNow: Stripe payments are required at booking. Saved cards remain available for follow-up charges.
alerts.cardOnFile: Clients will not pay during checkout, but they can safely store a card so managers can charge them later.
alerts.offline: Bookings are created without Stripe. Use manager payments or external billing to collect funds.

pricesIncludeTax.label: Prices include tax
pricesIncludeTax.helper: When on, displayed prices already include tax and Stripe backs the tax out.

chargeModes.localized: Localized (USD for US, CAD for CA)

taxRegion.overrideHelper: Optional override when Stripe needs a specific region code.

displayCurrency.label: Display currency
displayCurrency.helper: Display currency follows your tax country while localized pricing is enabled.

offline.title: Offline booking
offline.description: Clients book without providing payment information. Collect payment outside of Stripe.

cardOnFile.title: Card on file
cardOnFile.description: Clients secure an appointment and store a card so managers can charge it later from the dashboard.

payNow.title: Pay during checkout
payNow.description: Clients pay immediately with Stripe. Cards can remain on file for follow-up charges or refunds.

taxGuide.title: Tax setup guide (for managers)
taxGuide.intro: Follow this once and tax will be calculated automatically on every payment.

pricesIncludeTax.on: Prices include tax: (currently ON — prices shown include tax)
pricesIncludeTax.off: Prices include tax: (currently OFF — tax will be added on top)

connect.heading: 2) Connect Stripe (one-time)
connect.useButton: Use the Connect with Stripe button above and finish onboarding.
connect.ready: When it says Ready to accept payments, you're all set.

stripe.heading: 3) In Stripe — turn on Automatic tax
stripe.navigate: Go to Tax → Overview and switch Automatic tax to ON.
stripe.origin: In Business information: set your Origin address (where your business is based).
stripe.products: In Products & prices: pick a default tax category (start with “General — Services”; you can refine per product later).
stripe.includeQuestion: Include tax in prices? Choose No to add tax on top (most US/CA teams), or Yes if your prices already include tax.

registrations.heading: 4) Registrations (where you collect tax)
registrations.homeRegion: Add your home region (e.g., Ontario or Texas).
registrations.additionalRegions: Add other provinces/states only where you are registered or when Stripe notifies you that a threshold is met.
registrations.thresholds: Enable Thresholds monitoring so Stripe alerts you as you grow.

taxGuide.tip: Tip: If your price is $40 and Prices include tax is OFF, customers will see $40 + tax at checkout. If it’s ON, the $40 already contains tax and Stripe will back the tax out automatically.

faqs.title: FAQs
faqs.usRegistration: Do I need US registration to sell to US customers? Only if you meet a state's threshold or choose to register there. Start with your home region; add others as needed.
faqs.receipts: Does Stripe handle receipts? Yes. Receipts are issued in your business name.
faqs.crossBorder: What about cross-border orders? Tax depends on the buyer's location and where you're registered. If you aren't registered in a region, Stripe won't collect there.

messages.publicSnapshot: Showing public snapshot of pages (read-only). Use Visual Site Builder to edit.

errors.pageLoad: Failed to load pages. Visual Builder may still work.

alerts.publicSnapshot: Manager page endpoints are not available; showing public snapshot (read-only). Use <builderLink>Visual Site Builder</builderLink> to edit.
alerts.readOnlyMode: Read-only mode. Open <builderLink>Visual Site Builder</builderLink> to modify content.

sections.title: Buy a new domain
body: Prefer .com when available?customers trust it the most.
Start with the www version (www.yoursite.com). You can add the apex later if needed.
Avoid trademarks or other brands in your domain to prevent DNS issues.

sections.title: Connect an existing domain
body: Generate the TXT and CNAME records from Schedulaa.
Add those records at your DNS provider (GoDaddy, Namecheap, Cloudflare, etc.).
DNS can take up to 30 minutes to propagate?verify a little later if it is still pending.

sections.title: Where to click in GoDaddy
body: Log into GoDaddy and open your domain.
Add a TXT record named _schedulaa and paste the token from this screen.
Add a CNAME record for www pointing to schedulaa.com, then save your changes.

sections.title: Common gotchas
body: Removing old A records is important?otherwise browsers may continue to point to the legacy site.
If you purchased the domain recently, registrars sometimes block updates for the first few minutes.
DNS hosts that proxy (like Cloudflare orange-cloud) may require you to disable proxy until verification completes.

pending.title: Waiting on GoDaddy
pending.description: We asked GoDaddy to create the DNS records. This usually takes under a minute.

verifying.title: Verifying DNS
verifying.description: We are checking for the new records and will refresh automatically.

completed.title: Records Created
completed.description: GoDaddy confirmed the records. We will finish verification shortly?no action needed.

failed.title: Domain Connect failed
failed.description: GoDaddy could not create the records automatically. You can retry or switch to manual instructions.

notifications.dnsGenerated: DNS instructions generated. Add the TXT/CNAME records, then click Verify.
notifications.verifyPending: DNS records not found yet. Try again in a few minutes.
notifications.domainRemoved: Domain removed. Visitors will use the schedulaa.com link.
notifications.notifyEnabled: We will notify you when the domain is live.
notifications.copyFailed: Copy failed. Highlight the text manually.
notifications.connectCreated: Domain Connect session created. Follow the GoDaddy prompt in a new tab.
notifications.selectCompany: Select a company to manage domains.

validation.invalidDomain: Domain looks invalid. Use hostnames like www.example.com.
validation.connectEnterDomain: Enter a domain before starting Domain Connect.

instructions.title: DNS Instructions
instructions.tooltip: Add these records at your DNS provider, then click Verify

buttons.setupHelp: We can set this up for you

manual.helper: Enter the hostname customers will use.
manual.sslPending: SSL is provisioning. This usually takes a couple of minutes after DNS is verified.
manual.liveUrlVerified: Visitors will be directed to your verified custom domain.
manual.liveUrlPending: Until the domain is verified, schedulaa.com links will remain active.
manual.notifyToggle: Email me when SSL goes live

connect.description: Auto-connect uses GoDaddy Domain Connect to apply the TXT and CNAME records for you. After you approve the GoDaddy prompt, we will verify DNS automatically.
connect.registrarDetected: Detected registrar: {{registrar}}. Edit this if you want to connect a different host.
connect.recordsConfirmed: GoDaddy confirmed DNS records. Manual instructions remain available below if you need them.

domainHelp.title: Custom Domain Guide
domainHelp.subtitle: Follow these steps to connect your marketing site or booking experience to your own domain.

labels.registrarPlaybooksSubtitle: Use these guides for the registrars our customers rely on the most.

quickSummary.title: Quick summary
items: Buy a domain (GoDaddy / Namecheap / Cloudflare).
Add the TXT + CNAME records from Schedulaa.
Click Verify DNS in Schedulaa.
Wait for SSL to activate. Done!

dnsInstructions.title: What "DNS instructions generated" means
items: When you see this message, Schedulaa has already produced the DNS records you need to finish setup.
You will also see the DNS Instructions box appear below the button with both records ready to copy.
TXT record: proves you own the domain so only your team can connect it.
CNAME record: routes www to Schedulaa so visitors reach your booking site.
Log into your registrar (GoDaddy, Namecheap, Cloudflare, etc.), open DNS Records or Manage Zones, and add both records exactly as shown.
TXT record - Name/Host: _schedulaa (or _schedulaa.www if required) | Value: the random token displayed in Schedulaa.
CNAME record - Name/Host: www | Points to: schedulaa.com.
Save your changes and wait 5-30 minutes for DNS to update, then return to Schedulaa and click Verify DNS.
Once verified, https://www.yourdomain.com is live, SSL auto-issues, and all booking links, Stripe checkouts, and emails use your brand domain.
The TXT value you see in Schedulaa is your verification token; copy it exactly.

timing.title: How long does DNS take?
items: Most changes appear within 5-15 minutes.
Some registrars can take up to 1 hour.
Schedulaa automatically checks every few minutes; you can also click Refresh Status.

security.title: Security and SSL
items: Every verified domain automatically gets a TLS (SSL) certificate so visitor data stays encrypted end-to-end.
Certificates renew automatically. There is no manual work required.
Schedulaa only issues certificates after ownership is verified, so nobody else can claim your domain.
You will see SSL Pending and then SSL Active in Schedulaa after verification; no manual certificate install is needed.

baseSections.title: Before you start
bullets: Confirm you have manager permissions for this company.
Decide which hostname you want customers to use (we recommend www.yoursite.com for launch).
Have your DNS credentials ready so you can add TXT and CNAME records without delay.

baseSections.title: Purchase or choose a domain
bullets: If you need a new domain, buy it now (GoDaddy, Namecheap, Cloudflare, or your preferred registrar).
Use a clear brand name and prefer .com when available.
Keep both www and bare versions handy in case you want apex forwarding later.

baseSections.title: Generate DNS instructions
bullets: Enter the domain inside Schedulaa and click Generate DNS Instructions.
Schedulaa issues a TXT record for ownership and a CNAME to route traffic.
Leave the instructions open so you can copy the exact host/value pairs into your DNS portal.

baseSections.title: Add DNS records at your registrar
bullets: Create the TXT record named _schedulaa with the token we provide.
Add the CNAME record for www (or your chosen host) pointing to schedulaa.com.
Save changes and give DNS a few minutes to propagate before you verify.
baseSections.tip: Tip: DNS instructions generated means Schedulaa already created your verification records. Add them to your registrar, save, and click Verify DNS to finish.

baseSections.title: Verify and go live
bullets: Back in Schedulaa, click Verify DNS.
When verification succeeds, SSL provisioning starts automatically (Caddy or Cloudflare depending on your plan).
Once SSL is active, flip any marketing links and emails to the new domain.

baseSections.title: Post-launch checklist
bullets: Visit the new domain in an incognito window to ensure redirects and branding look right.
Update Stripe, email templates, and QR codes?they already use tenantBaseUrl but double-check your saved copy.
Enable the email notification toggle in Schedulaa so managers know when SSL or DNS changes occur.

connectSteps.title: GoDaddy Domain Connect
bullets: Start from Schedulaa using the Connect automatically button when we detect GoDaddy.
Approve the GoDaddy prompt - this authorizes us to add the TXT and CNAME on your behalf.
Return to Schedulaa; we will poll GoDaddy, verify DNS, and start SSL automatically.

connectSteps.title: GoDaddy manual fallback
bullets: If Domain Connect fails, open GoDaddy > My Products > DNS > Manage Zones.
Add TXT _schedulaa with the token from Schedulaa. Add CNAME www pointing to schedulaa.com.
Save and retry verification after a few minutes. Disable proxy or CDN if records still do not resolve.

connectSteps.title: Namecheap manual steps
bullets: Go to Domain List > Manage > Advanced DNS.
Add a TXT record with host _schedulaa and the verification token, TTL 1 minute or Automatic.
Add a CNAME record for www pointing to schedulaa.com, save, then verify inside Schedulaa.

connectSteps.title: Cloudflare registrar or proxy
bullets: In Cloudflare, add the TXT and CNAME records under DNS > Records.
If proxy (orange cloud) is enabled for the CNAME, temporarily switch it to DNS only until verification finishes.
After SSL is active in Schedulaa, you can re-enable the proxy to leverage Cloudflare caching.

rows.fix: Use the exact record shown in Schedulaa.
Delete the A record for www before adding the CNAME.
Wait 30 minutes, then click Verify DNS again.

rows.cause: Another account connected the same domain
rows.fix: Contact Schedulaa Support so we can transfer ownership.

advanced.title: Advanced options (later)
items: Automatic setup (GoDaddy Domain Connect): When available, click Connect Automatically and skip manual DNS entries.
Cloudflare proxy: Turn the orange cloud off during verification, then back on once SSL is active.
Apex forwarding: After www is live, add a forward from yourdomain.com to www.yourdomain.com inside your registrar dashboard.

ownership.title: Ownership and safety
items: You always keep full control of your domain at your registrar.
Schedulaa cannot transfer, bill, or renew domains on your behalf.
We simply verify ownership so the booking site can run securely on your hostname.

supportSections.title: Need more help?
bullets: Schedulaa support can walk you through DNS changes or complete Domain Connect on your behalf.
Share screenshots of your DNS zone or the exact error message to speed up troubleshooting.

commands.title: Check with a command line (optional)
items: nslookup -type=txt _schedulaa.www.yourdomain.com
nslookup -type=cname www.yourdomain.com
commands.footer: If both commands return the correct values, return to Schedulaa and click Verify DNS.

summary.title: In summary
items: Serve securely over HTTPS.
Show your company name and branding everywhere.
Keep SSL renewals automatic without extra tools.
Stay safe - Schedulaa only connects, never owns your domain.

notifications.verifyDomain: Verify a custom domain before using it as the canonical host.

errors.invalidOgImage: Open Graph image must be a valid URL (https://.)
errors.lockedCanonical: Custom canonical domain requires a verified hostname.
errors.invalidCustomDomain: Custom domain looks invalid. Fix it before saving.

canonical.lockedMessage: Verify your custom domain to unlock canonical hosting.

preview.custom: Search engines will treat your custom domain as canonical.
preview.slug: Until verified, schedulaa.com links remain the canonical host.

copy.heading: Scheduling, payroll, and online sales that work together.

Export-ready tax forms (W-2, T4, ROE).

description: Real-time client bookings with service selection and self-serve rescheduling.
Employee availability, shift templates, and multi-branch support.
Shift swaps, leave requests, and recurring availability rules.
Automated reminders, digital tips, reviews, and post-visit feedback collection.

features.title: Powerful Payroll & HR
description: Canada + 45 U.S. states supported (EI, CPP, automated stat holiday pay, W-2, T4, ROE).
Pay-rate assignment per employee, overtime tiers, province/state holiday rules, and deductions.
Export payroll journals or plug into remittance APIs for hands-free filing.
Employee onboarding, time tracking, and performance workflows in one place.

Theme customization across fonts, colors, backgrounds, and layout blocks.
Add or remove pages, rearrange navigation, and publish changes instantly.
Connect or purchase a custom domain with SEO-ready structure baked in.

Secure checkout via Stripe Connect with refunds, partial refunds, and tipping.
Inventory management, pricing controls, and variant options by SKU.

Tax, payout, and settlement reporting with exportable CSV dashboards.
Insights to drive smarter decisions, forecast demand, and spot gaps early.

Webhooks and REST APIs to trigger workflows or keep external systems in sync.
Scheduler automations for re-engagement campaigns, no-show alerts, and follow-ups.
Embed widgets and booking flows directly into existing sites and partner portals.

features.title: Security, Compliance & Scale
description: Role-based access control for managers, admins, recruiters, and employees.
Secure data storage with encryption, audit logs, and automated backups.
Multi-location, multi-branch support with centralized oversight.
Compliance with regional payroll and privacy regulations out of the box.

cards.title: Account and Workspace Setup
items: Create your manager account and verify email
Invite staff and assign manager, staff, or admin permissions
Pick a profession template (salon, recruiter, fitness, real estate, photography, etc.)
Connect Stripe for payouts, checkout, and card-on-file (required for live transactions)

cards.title: Company Profile and Branding
items: Configure business hours, tax settings, and currency
Upload logos, theme colors, booking widgets, and notifications
Link an existing custom domain; in-app domain purchase is coming soon

cards.title: Operational Foundations
items: Build services, add-ons, departments, and branch catalogs
Publish availability templates, recurring schedules, and shift rotations
Enable Stripe Tax to automate tax calculations for products and add-ons
Review notification defaults, reminders, and marketing campaigns

highlights: Service catalog setup with durations, buffers, and add-ons
Recurring availability and editable slots (Vagaro-style)

Clients get confirmations, reminders, tips, reviews, and memberships

highlights: Employee profiles with pay rates, roles, and compliance notes
Timesheet approvals, batch payroll, and overrides
Shift swap requests and leave approvals with manager review
Overtime, holidays, and bonuses calculated automatically
Exports ready for 45 U.S. states + all Canadian provinces (except QC)

cards.title: Website Builder
highlights: Industry-specific templates with hero, reviews, and contact pages
Instant theme customization for colors, fonts, navigation
Version history, visual editor, and auto-publishing
Custom domain linking (in-app purchase coming soon)

cards.title: Commerce and Products
highlights: Mixed carts for services, products, and add-ons via Stripe Checkout
Coupons, gift cards, refunds, and Stripe Tax automation
Save card on file and manage payouts through Stripe
Track order history, reconciled refunds, and revenue per location

cards.title: Analytics and Reporting
highlights: Monitor revenue, retention, utilization, and churn
Drill into providers, departments, and campaigns
Advanced dashboards for tips, refunds, and marketing
Export reports to CSV or connect to BI tools

cards.title: Automations and Integrations
highlights: Configure outbound webhooks with signature verification
Trigger emails, SMS, and win-back campaigns automatically
Stripe for payments, payouts, and tax automation
QuickBooks/Xero exports; Jitsi for virtual sessions
Zapier, Slack notifications, and in-app domains coming soon

items.details: Notifications for new bookings, cancellations, and shift changes.

items.name: Domain Purchase
items.details: Buy and connect custom domains without leaving Schedulaa.

items.question: How long does onboarding take?
items.answer: Most teams launch within 7-14 days using the quick-start checklists and import templates in the docs.

items.question: Can clients purchase both services and products?
items.answer: Yes. Clients can add multiple services, add-ons, or merchandise items to their cart and complete checkout securely through Stripe.

items.question: Do you support Zapier or custom webhooks?
items.answer: Webhooks are fully supported. Zapier integration is in development for later 2025.

items.question: Do you offer data migration?
items.answer: Yes. Contact support for CSV import templates or request managed migration for an additional fee.

schema.question: How long does onboarding take?
schema.answer: Most teams launch within 7-14 days using the quick-start checklists and import templates in the docs.

schema.question: Does Schedulaa offer a full API reference?
schema.answer: Yes. The API section covers authentication, webhooks, scheduling, payroll, and site management endpoints.

schema.question: Where can I find integration walkthroughs?
schema.answer: Integration guides cover payments, messaging, video, and analytics connectors with step-by-step instructions.

entries: Added profession-based onboarding templates and customizable email invitations.
Enabled Stripe Tax for product-based transactions.
Launched refund handling for services and merchandise.
Introduced locale packs for French and German
Upgraded booking embed to support recurring appointments
New management dashboards for franchise groups

footer.helpText: Need more help? Visit the <supportLink>Help Center</supportLink> or email <supportEmail>support@schedulaa.com</supportEmail>.

meta.title: Schedulaa Pricing | Launch on your own domain with automatic SSL
meta.description: Compare Starter, Pro, and Business plans. Custom domains with automatic SSL are included on Pro and Business; Starter can add it for $5/month.

og.title: Schedulaa Pricing
og.description: Plans for every stage. Launch on your own domain with automatic SSL included on Pro and Business.

title: Pricing that grows with you.
Launch on your own domain with automatic SSL.
hero.subtitle: Custom domains (TXT/CNAME) with automatic SSL are now included on Pro and Business. Starter can add it as an add-on for $5/month.
hero.mediaAlt: Schedulaa pricing overview showing plans and platform map

list.name: Starter
list.description: Launch your website and start taking bookings and payments  perfect for solo professionals.
features: Website builder with branded pages and templates.
Online booking, confirmations, and client portal.
Stripe Checkout with Automatic Tax compliance.
1 staff seat and 1 location included.
CSV and PDF reports for revenue and appointments.
Custom domain + automatic SSL (add-on $5/mo).

list.name: Pro
list.description: For small teams that need staff scheduling, marketing automation, and analytics.
features: Everything in Starter.
Custom domain + automatic SSL included.
Up to 5 staff seats and 1 location included.
Email campaigns: Broadcast, Win-Back, VIP, No-Show, Anniversary.
Advanced Analytics (bookings, revenue, client segments).
Employee Payslip Portal (self-serve PDF downloads).
Automated Canadian stat holiday pay and accruals.
Priority support (business hours).

list.name: Business
list.description: For established teams managing advanced payroll, compliance, and analytics.
features: Everything in Pro.
10 staff seats and up to 2 locations included.
Add additional staff seats for $10/mo each.
Compliance Documents Pack: W-2 (US), T4 (CA), ROE (CA) creation & export (PDF/XML).
Advanced payroll exports, audits, and tax reports.
Role-based access (managers / staff / finance).
Team scheduling controls (bulk close / keep windows).
24/7 priority support.
Free branded website included when using Payroll + Scheduling.

assurances.title: Transparent pricing, enterprise-grade platform
assurances.subtitle: Secure, scalable, and fast: launch branded sites, process payments, and automate payroll from one login.

items.title: No hidden fees
items.description: Simple Stripe-based pricing with predictable processing rates.

items.title: Switch plans anytime
items.description: Upgrade or downgrade as your team grows; your custom domain follows instantly.

items.title: Branded websites
items.description: Custom domains with TXT/CNAME verification and automatic SSL on Pro and Business.

items.title: Enterprise onboarding
items.description: Guided setup for multi-location brands with tax and payroll mapping.

items.title: Role-based access
items.description: Managers, staff, and finance roles keep scheduling and payroll secure by default.

items.title: Global payments ready
items.description: Stripe Checkout with refunds, saved cards, and cross-border payouts.

ribbon.message: New: Custom domains (TXT/CNAME) with automatic SSL are included on Pro and Business. Starter can add it as an add-on.

footnote.message: Custom domain + automatic SSL: included on Pro and Business. Available on Starter as an add-on ($5 / month).

ctaBanner.title: Start your free trial - no credit card required
ctaBanner.description: Bring scheduling, payments, and payroll into one workspace backed by automatic SSL on your own domain.

meta.title: About Photo Artisto Corp. | Makers of Schedulaa
meta.description: Learn how Photo Artisto Corp. built Schedulaa to give creative teams a single operating system for booking, payroll, HR, and commerce.

og.title: About Photo Artisto Corp.
og.description: We built Schedulaa to free creatives from juggling disjointed software.

title: The team behind
Schedulaa.
hero.subtitle: Schedulaa started inside Photo Artisto Corp. as the all-in-one platform our stylists, photographers, recruiters, and studios needed to run bookings, payroll, campaigns, and HR without juggling tools.

intro.title: A single operating system for creative teams
intro.subtitle: Every feature and workflow ships to remove friction for teams who create unforgettable client experiences.

values.title: Design for busy creatives
values.description: Every workflow trims clicks so stylists, recruiters, and staff can focus on clients.

values.title: Unify the toolset
values.description: Scheduling, payroll, websites, commerce, and analytics live in one system.

values.title: Earn trust every payday
values.description: Compliance-ready payroll and audit trails keep teams confident on every run.

values.title: Build for global teams
values.description: Local currencies, languages, and regulations are first-class citizens in Schedulaa.

values.title: Keep data secure
values.description: Role-based permissions, audit logging, and encryption standards protect every client touchpoint.

values.title: Partner with your team
values.description: Dedicated onboarding, live chat, and success managers help every location launch smoothly.

items.description: Photo Artisto Corp. launched to help stylists solve booking chaos.
Internal tool evolved into Schedulaa, integrating scheduling, payroll, and storefront.
Added HR, interviews, website builder, custom domains, and payroll in CA/US.

mission.title: Mission
mission.body: We give every creative team, salon, studio, and recruiter a single operating system for booking, payroll, marketing, HR, and commerce so they can focus on clients instead of juggling software.
